markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Quilted Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=33)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Comfort" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=203" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 11 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 3 gp

**AC Bonus** +2

**Dex Cap** +2

**Check Penalty** -1

**Speed Penalty** —
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** 12

**Bulk** 1

**Category** Light

**Group** Cloth
</row>

</column>

---

Quilted armor is built in a long coat intended for defensive use without other armor. Quilted armor protects the upper body and legs, differentiating it further from the typical padded undercoat. This armor is frequently made in stylish colors or patterns to facilitate use as protective outerwear or a military uniform.

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-5" />
name: Quilted Armor
